issue.summary: CH73-149K24 needs to be placed onto chr:19

issue.summary: Chromosome 19 assembly gap (BX004966.12 - BX957357.12)
issue.description: Assembly gap between BX004966.12 (DKEY-5E12) and BX957357.12 (DKEY-98L21).
issue.resolution_text: CH73-278J10 (FO704838.1) spans the gap between these two components and has a good alignment to both of them. This issue can now be resolved.

issue.summary: Chromosome 19 path problem (CR792420.9 - CT583726.28)
issue.description: Path problem between CR792420.9 (DKEY-34K9) and CT583726.28 (DKEYP-22C6).
issue.resolution_text: PGP self comp and EAO suggest that CR792420.9 is contained in CT583726.28. The clone chosen for this region, CH1073-426H8, has the same end hit on both components which also supports this conclusion. I will remove CR792420.9 from the TPF. It also appears that CH1073-426H8 was incorrectly picked as the end hit does not point into the gap. I will ask for the clone to be cancelled.

issue.summary: Chromosome 19 assembly gap (CU896645.12 - CT583726.28)
issue.description: Assembly gap between CU896645.12 (CH211-57N23) and CT583726.28 (DKEYP-22C6).
issue.resolution_text: The flanking regions of this gap have changed. This ticket has been resolved. A new ticket has been opened to deal with the gap in this region.

issue.summary: Clone CR626876.6 (DKEY-95J14) is probably deleted, potentially affecting the yet missing tril gene
issue.status_text: CR626876.6 has been removed from the tile path as deleted. HTGS_PHASE2 component, FO904961.2 has been added in its place and aligns to the tril gene.
issue.description: Clone CR626876.6 (DKEY-95J14) is probably deleted.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Contig order/orientation problem
issue.description: Optical map analysis indicates the contig comprising components CT027837.9-BX005062.4 is in the wrong orientation and is placed between components AL844521.15 and BX324128.14 (ZG-3763)
issue.resolution_text: The contig has been repositioned according to the data in the ticket. The tickets associated with this region have been adjusted,

issue.summary: Contig order/orientation problem
issue.description: Optical map analysis indicates that contig comprising components CT583726.28-CT737129.12 is in the wrong orientation and is placed between components BX510325.3 and CU469581.10 (ZG-3776)
issue.resolution_text: Contig ctg2704 was revealed by optical map data analyisis to be in the wrong orientation. This has now been corrected. Additionally a component that had previously been removed, which provideed extra sequence, has been restored.

issue.summary: Contig orientation problem
issue.description: Optical map analysis indicates that the contig comprising CU929219.5-CU104788.3 is in the wrong orientation in the TPF.
issue.resolution_text: Contig ctg4513 has had its orientation reversed based on optical map data analysis.

issue.summary: There is a path problem between CU856207.13 and FO082782.4
issue.description: There is a path problem between CU856207.13 and FO082782.4
issue.resolution_text: FO082782.4 has been removed from the TPF as it is redundant under CU856207.13. There is a ~200bp insertion in FO082782.4 relative to CU856207.13, but the inserted data consists mainly of di-nucleotide repeats. Removal of FO082782.4 does not appear to affect any of the surrounding genes.

issue.summary: Chromosome 19 path update
issue.status_text: Awaiting lift of freeze for Zv10 in order to update region to include CU628003 in the tpf.
issue.description: CU628003.5 should be moved between FO704878.2 and CU856154.5. It contains ~1.8kb of non repetitive sequence. I will add it to the TPF as a contained component in FO704878.2, altering the switchpoint to maximise the sequence.
